commit_message:
Add shell command bay-config

Generate the required configuration for the corresponding native client
of a given bay. Output the appropriate export or setenv commands with
the native client's environment variables, ready for clients to source.

In the case of kubernetes also generate a config file which is pointed
by the KUBECONFIG env var. In the case of docker the config file does
not support this and all goes into env vars.

Change-Id: I44700b97ba3efc4c818112c95f80adf723048c5a
Implements: blueprint magnum-coe-client-config
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-magnumclient refs/changes/53/342153/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import os, sys from OpenSSL import crypto, SSL @utils.arg('bay', metavar='<bay>', help='ID or name of the bay to retrieve config.') @utils.arg('--dir', metavar='<dir>', default='.', help='Directory to save the certificate and config files.') @utils.arg('--force', action='store_true', default=False, help='Overwrite files if existing.') def do_bay_config(cs, args): """Configure native client to access bay. You can source the output of this command to get the native client of the corresponding COE configured to access the bay. Example: eval $(magnum bay-config <bay-name>) """ try: bay = cs.bays.get(args.bay) baymodel = cs.baymodels.get(bay.baymodel_id) opts = { 'bay_uuid': bay.uuid, } tls = _generate_csr_and_key() tls['ca'] = cs.certificates.get(**opts).pem opts['csr'] = tls['csr'] tls['cert'] = cs.certificates.create(**opts).pem for k in ('key', 'cert', 'ca'): fname = "%s/%s.pem" % (args.dir, k) if os.path.exists(fname) and not args.force: print "File %s exists, aborting." % fname sys.exit(1) else: f = open(fname, "w") f.write(tls[k]) f.close() print _config_bay(bay, baymodel, cfg_dir=args.dir, force=args.force) except Exception as e: print("Config retrieval for bay %s failed: %s" % (args.bay, e)) def _config_bay(bay, baymodel, cfg_dir='.', force=False): """Return and write configuration for the given bay.""" if baymodel.coe == 'kubernetes': return _config_bay_kubernetes(bay, baymodel, cfg_dir, force) elif baymodel.coe == 'swarm': return _config_bay_swarm(bay, baymodel, cfg_dir, force) def _config_bay_kubernetes(bay, baymodel, cfg_dir='.', force=False): """Return and write configuration for the given kubernetes bay.""" cfg_file = "%s/config" % cfg_dir if baymodel.tls_disabled: cfg = """ apiVersion: v1 clusters: - cluster: server: %(api_address)s name: %(name)s contexts: - context: cluster: %(name)s user: %(name)s name: default/%(name)s current-context: default/%(name)s kind: Config preferences: {} users: - name: %(name)s """ % {'name': bay.name, 'api_address': bay.api_address} else: cfg = """ apiVersion: v1 clusters: - cluster: certificate-authority: ca.pem server: %(api_address)s name: %(name)s contexts: - context: cluster: %(name)s user: %(name)s name: default/%(name)s current-context: default/%(name)s kind: Config preferences: {} users: - name: %(name)s user: client-certificate: cert.pem client-key: key.pem """ % {'name': bay.name, 'api_address': bay.api_address} if os.path.exists(cfg_file) and not force: print "File %s exists, aborting." % cfg_file sys.exit(1) else: f = open(cfg_file, "w") f.write(cfg) f.close() if 'csh' in os.environ['SHELL']: return "setenv KUBECONFIG %s\n" % cfg_file else: return "export KUBECONFIG=%s\n" % cfg_file def _config_bay_swarm(bay, baymodel, cfg_dir='.', force=False): """Return and write configuration for the given swarm bay.""" if 'csh' in os.environ['SHELL']: result = "setenv DOCKER_HOST %s" % bay.api_address else: result = "export DOCKER_HOST=%s" % bay.api_address if not baymodel.tls_disabled: if 'csh' in os.environ['SHELL']: result += """ setenv DOCKER_CERT_PATH %(cfg_dir)s setenv DOCKER_TLS_VERIFY true """ % {'cfg_dir': cfg_dir} else: result += """ export DOCKER_CERT_PATH=%(cfg_dir)s export DOCKER_TLS_VERIFY=true """ % {'cfg_dir': cfg_dir} return result def _generate_csr_and_key(): """Return a dict with a new csr and key.""" csr = crypto.X509Req() csr.get_subject().CN = 'Magnum User' key = crypto.PKey() key.generate_key(crypto.TYPE_RSA, 2048) csr.set_pubkey(key) csr.sign(key, "sha1") result = { 'csr': crypto.dump_certificate_request(crypto.FILETYPE_PEM, csr), 'key': crypto.dump_privatekey(crypto.FILETYPE_PEM, key) } return result

commit_message:
Update the magnum client to send the latest version.

In Magnum client, Magnum calls should include the OpenStack-API-Version
header with the value of 'latest' as default, so that the latest
version of Magnum API is run.

Change-Id: I324a88d5e70ea9d68e7caf59061f5ad0807d37aa

commit_message:
Prevent CPU spinning when there are no children

If you deploy an object server but have no rings at all (and are using
servers-per-port), then the CPU will spin as it checks for child
processes since there are actually no child processes to check.

This patch adds a sleep so that the CPU doesn't spin.

Change-Id: Iece62367aa2481a21752144b1f4477a3713282fe
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/71/344971/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: try: pid, status = green_os.wait() if os.WIFEXITED(status) or os.WIFSIGNALED(status): strategy.register_worker_exit(pid) except OSError as err: if err.errno not in (errno.EINTR, errno.ECHILD): raise if err.errno == errno.ECHILD: # If there are no children at all (ECHILD), then # there's nothing to actually wait on. We sleep # for the loop_timeout to avoid a tight CPU spin # and still are able to catch any KeyboardInterrupt # events that happen. sleep(loop_timeout)

commit_message:
Remove force option from create_snapshots_in_db()

Removing force option from create_snapshots_in_db() since it is not
needed because this function is only used by create_cgsnapshot() and
the force flag is always True.

Change-Id: I04f67334168651a9e1da06179b0cf93b640c95ca
Signed-off-by: Nitin Madhok <nmadhok@g.clemson.edu>

commit_message:
Improve error handling for invalid resource ID

When retrieving secret with invalid formatted UUID, added checks
to validate UUID format and only then make request to db.

Change-Id: I177e173aa3cab71833b01bbb64506df68845336f
Closes-Bug: #1603828
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/barbican refs/changes/60/343760/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _invalid_secret_id(): """Throw exception that secret id format is invalid.""" pecan.abort(404, u._("Invalid secret id format.")) def _valid_secret_id_format(self, secret_id): if len(secret_id) != 36: return False idParts = secret_id.split('-') if len(idParts) != 5: return False if ((len(idParts[0]) != 8) or (len(idParts[1]) != 4) or (len(idParts[2]) != 4) or (len(idParts[3]) != 4) or (len(idParts[4]) != 12)): return False return True # Check for valid secret_id format before makind db call. if not self._valid_secret_id_format(str(secret_id)): _invalid_secret_id()
